comment.author: 81674810@N06
comment._content: I'm a little confused by this one.  Is this supposed the old Toronto Stock Exchange building? I thought the facade of that (or at least a replica) was incorporated into the Toronto Dominion Centre.  But those two facades don't look the same.  So what 'Exchange' is this?  Could someone clarify?

comment.author: 97794020@N00
comment._content: The Toronto Royal Exchange, built 1855, north side of Wellington St, east of Yonge, beside Berczy Lane (reproduced in "Toronto's Visual Legacy: Official City Photography from 1856 to the Present" by S. MacKinnon, K. Teeple and M. Dale, James Lorimer 2009.)

comment.author: 81674810@N06
comment._content: Some further investigation finds that this was set up as a focus for the grain trade. The Building itself was later used as the Imperial Bank's headquarters in Toronto. I have not seen any use of the word 'Royal' in association with this building, though. www.biographi.ca/009004-119.01-e.php?&id_nbr=4248&... www.heritagetoronto.org/discover-toronto/photos/toronto-e...
